message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with the problem of improving human hand pose sensing device performance, which involves robotics (cs.RO) and computer vision (cs.CV) techniques. The paper also discusses the use of statistical a priori information and optimization techniques, which are common in machine learning (cs.LG) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC) research. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of synergy-based techniques, which are related to the concept of synergies in human motor control and could be classified under the sub-category of systems and control (cs.SY).
